meta.title: Digg - What the Internet is talking about right now

div.div: Everyone is still trying to make sense (or in the Democrats' case, make hay with) Mitt Romney's disparging remarks about "the 47 percent," but where did he come with that number and why are these people not paying income taxes?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RpNIto&via=Digg&text=Who Are Mitt Romney's 47%?

div.a: Nevada Recluse Dies With $7M In Gold Stashed In His Garage

div.div: 69-year-old Walter Samasko had just $200 in his bank account. The contents of his garage, however, put him in a very different tax bracket.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Po6u63&via=Digg&text=Nevada Recluse Dies With $7M In Gold Stashed In His Garage

div.a: Is This The First Photo Of An iPad Mini?

div.div: A new mockup of the Apple's so-called "iPad mini" showed up on a Chinese website early Tuesday, with the non-working unit appearing to have a fabricated front glass attached to the device's rumored backplate.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SXpXiY&via=Digg&text=Is This The First Photo Of An iPad Mini?

div.div: FEELS LIKE THE FIRST TIME... OR NOT

div.a: Adventures With The Artificial Hymen Kit

div.div: For 30 dollars, Hymen Shop ships from Hong Kong to just about anywhere in the world. Simply click, buy, insert, and voilà: virginity restored.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OaPOSO&via=Digg&text=Adventures With The Artificial Hymen Kit

div.a: Corruption In Wikiland? Paid PR Scandal Erupts At Wikipedia

div.div: Concerned Wikipedians raised the alarm Monday that two trusted men are allegedly editing Wikipedia pages and facilitating front-page placement for their pay-for-play, publicity-seeking clients.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OXjfn2&via=Digg&text=Corruption In Wikiland? Paid PR Scandal Erupts At Wikipedia

div.a: Muslim Hackers Claim Responsibility For Bank Of America, NYSE Attacks

div.div: Bank of America customers have had a hard time accessing the bank’s website today–and a claim posted by a Muslim hacker group on Pastebin.com may have something to do with that.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Ob7y0h&via=Digg&text=Muslim Hackers Claim Responsibility For Bank Of America, NYSE Attacks

div.a: Captain America Becomes President America Next Week

div.div: It's okay, everybody: Marvel Comics has decided the 2012 election for you. And the publisher of Spider-Man and the Hulk comics has decided that their own Captain America would be a better president than Barack Obama or Mitt Romney.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OCY7Xx&via=Digg&text=Captain America Becomes President America Next Week

div.a: Mexican Drug Cartels Vs. Mitt Romney's Mormon Family

div.div: The Mexican drug cartels are at war... with Mormons.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QXYfPx&via=Digg&text=Mexican Drug Cartels Vs. Mitt Romney's Mormon Family

div.a: Sperm Can't Turn Left, Or Don't Want To

div.div: Researchers found that, rather than moving forward in a straight line, about 5 percent of sperm swim in a small helical, or corkscrew, pattern. Perhaps more surprising was that almost all (about 90%) of the helical swimmers spun to the right.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OBOqCR&via=Digg&text=Sperm Can't Turn Left, Or Don't Want To

div.a: The Chinese Google Just Took A Shot At Japan With A Jingoistic Doodle

div.div: Baidu Inc., China’s largest search- engine, and Tencent Holdings Ltd., the nation’s biggest Internet company, placed patriotic banners on their websites amid the worst diplomatic crisis with Japan since 2005.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OVqBYm&via=Digg&text=The Chinese Google Just Took A Shot At Japan With A Jingoistic Doodle

div.a: Did Jesus Marry Mary? A Controversial New Text Raises Religious Questions

div.div: According to a top religion scholar, this 1,600-year-old text fragment suggests that some early Christians believed Jesus was married—possibly to Mary Magdalene.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QXnqlu&via=Digg&text=Did Jesus Marry Mary? A Controversial New Text Raises Religious Questions

div.a: Clint Eastwood: Republicans Were 'Dumb' To Ask Me To Speak At RNC

div.div: Eastwood opened up in a recent interview with Extra's Jerry Penacoli, claiming, "If somebody’s dumb enough to ask me to go to a political convention and say something, they’re gonna have to take what they get.”

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/NApgZL&via=Digg&text=Clint Eastwood: Republicans Were 'Dumb' To Ask Me To Speak At RNC

div.div: Twitter is blocked in China, but wildly popular weibo platforms (Chinese microblogs) are frequently described as "China's version of Twitter." So what exactly is weibo and how does it stack up to Twitter?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S2byuJ&via=Digg&text=Twitter And Weibo: A Comparison

div.a: A Computer Program That Predicts Terrorist Attacks

div.div: A data-mining project that adapts analytics used by Amazon and big box retailers to predict customer behavior is now being used to stop terrorism before it starts.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/Pl7MPe&via=Digg&text=A Computer Program That Predicts Terrorist Attacks

div.a: iPhone 5 Review: Finally, The iPhone We've Always Wanted

div.div: The iPhone 5 is the iPhone we've wanted since 2010, adding long-overdue upgrades like a larger screen and faster 4G LTE in a razor-sharp new design. This is the iPhone, rebooted.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/va8V1c&via=Digg&text=iPhone 5 Review: Finally, The iPhone We've Always Wanted

div.a: Hall Of Mirrors: Remaking Reality In A Camera-Obsessed World

div.div: Our age has seen an explosion of this peculiarly human activity — recording activity — on a scale scarcely comprehensible even by those who've lived through it. What changes has this revolution wrought, not only in how we see the world, but how we live in it?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RnzSNG&via=Digg&text=Hall Of Mirrors: Remaking Reality In A Camera-Obsessed World

div.a: Apple's Jonathan Ive To Design A Single Uber-Limited Edition Leica M

div.div: Do you love the design of Apple products? Do you have infinitely deep pockets? If you said yes to both questions, then I have some good news for you.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/RlACTm&via=Digg&text=Apple's Jonathan Ive To Design A Single Uber-Limited Edition Leica M

div.a: The Unedited Secret Video Of Private Romney Fundraiser

div.div: Mitt Romney wanted the full tape. Here it is.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/SZyUrY&via=Digg&text=The Unedited Secret Video Of Private Romney Fundraiser

div.a: Endangered Armadillo Named World Cup Mascot

div.div: Spain had Naranjito the smiling orange in 1982, France Footix the football playing rooster in '98, now Brazil have chosen an endangered armadillo as the mascot for the 2014 World Cup.

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/QXVrC8&via=Digg&text=Endangered Armadillo Named World Cup Mascot

div.a: The Best Comic About Dogs You'll Read All Day

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/OTPVhe&via=Digg&text=The Best Comic About Dogs You'll Read All Day

div.div: Most books aren’t printed on 8 1/2 x 11 paper so why are these the standard paper dimensions?

a.href: https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?url=http://on.digg.com/S27yug&via=Digg&text=Why Is Paper 8 1/2 x 11?
